etymologies: mid 18th century: from Greek plērōma ‘that which fills’, from plēroun ‘make full’, from plērēs ‘full’

definitions: (in Gnosticism) the spiritual universe as the abode of God and of the totality of the divine powers and emanations.
shortDefinitions: (in Gnosticism) spiritual universe as abode of God and of totality of divine powers and emanations

definitions: (in Christian theology) the totality or fullness of the Godhead which dwells in Christ.
shortDefinitions: (in Christian theology) totality or fullness of Godhead which dwells in Christ
